summary: This document is an email from the DOJ's voicemail system forwarding a voice message from July 26, 2019, to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York's Epstein victims contact address. It indicates a communication was received by the office regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Voice Message Received by DOJ
events.description: A voice message was received by the Department of Justice, which was then forwarded via email to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York's Epstein victims contact address.

keyFacts: A voice message was received by the DOJ on July 26, 2019, and forwarded to the USANYS Epstein victims contact address on July 27, 2019.
The communication was handled through the DOJ's voip.usa.doj.gov email system, indicating official channels were used for victim or witness contact.
The attachment was a .wav audio file from a 'WIRELESS CALLER', suggesting the message came from a mobile phone.
The document shows the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York had a dedicated email address (USANYS.EpsteinVictims@usa.doj.gov) for communications related to Epstein victims.
The timing (July 2019) corresponds with the period shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, and before his death on August 10, 2019.
